title: What is the difference between an umbrella and a raincoat? - Quora

response.answer_text: Both an umbrella and a raincoat, protects us from rain. An umbrella can be used to protect ourselves even from the hot sun. But a raincoat can be used only during the rainy season. An umbrella should be held in our hand while using it, whereas, a raincoat should be worn on our body, to prevent from getting wet.

Umbrella is a "protective gadget".An umbrella is an object which you use to protect yourself from the rain or hot sun. It consists of a long stick with a folding frame covered in cloth.A Raincoat is a waterproof or water -resistant coat worn to protect the body from rain. The term rain jacket is sometimes used to refer to raincoats that are waist length. A rain jacket may be combined with a pair of rain pants to make a rain suit,a rain suit may also be in one piece like a boilersuit.
